title.narrative: Integrated Coastal Zone Management & Clean-Up Project (APL #1)

description.narrative: The Project Development Objective is to assist the Government of Albania in developing, on a sustainable basis, tourism in the South Albania coast by improving critical public environmental infrastructure and municipal services, remediating and containing pollution hazards from a former chemical plant in Porto Romano near Durres, improving community infrastructure and enhancing architectural and cultural resources.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Schedule 4, para 16 | Description :Carry out Social and Vulnerability Assessment | Due Date :31-Dec-2010

title.narrative: Improved waste disposal infrastructure for the Southern Coast built in Saranda area with capacity of 25,000 m3 per year and the accompanying transfer station in Himare.

baseline.value: No waste disposal infrastructure in place for the South Coast

target.value: Target achieved. The landfill company has taken over the landfill infrastructure for operation. Staff of the company has beentrained. Bajkaj landfill and Transfer Station in Himare operational under these conditions.

actual.value: Landfill construction and transfer station were completed including the works certification. The total capacity of the landfill is365,000 m3 which is sufficient for up to 17 yeasr of operation at 25,000 m3 waste annually. Both investments are under defectliability period.

title.narrative: Newly built waste landfill and transfer station capacity to service the population of the Southern Coast
Coastal communities and Local Government Units participate in Coastal Vilage Conservation Development (CVCD) Program identification

baseline.value: Communities actively participated in round one of the CVCD program

target.value: Traget substantially achieved. 1)Village infrastructure rehabilitation program completed 2)Roof and facade rehabilitation projectsimplemented in up to 62 houses; 3)Up to 20 homeowners involved in B&B services program

actual.value: Substantially achieved. Round 2 of CVCD includes 9 (nine) subprojects for the rehabilitation of the village roads and quares and 5(five) subprojects for the upgrade of the water supply systems in Allonjia, Dhermi, Qeparo, Palasa, Ilias, Himara Nivica, Lukovacommune, PIqeras, Pllake Qenuiro (Alico commune), Xarra, Ksamili, Vergo commune, Bajkai and Palavli villages. These villagesparticipated through the entire process of identification of investments, selection of contractors, supervision and co-financing.27 house were completed under the R&F program and their owners participated in the process and contributed with own funds.

title.narrative: Remediation of contaminated sites through removal and containment of hazardous materials in Porto Romano to reduce human health hazards

baseline.value: Contaminated materials from the site removed and safely stored (baseline at restructuting); Containment of on-site contaminationnot addressed

target.value: Safe landfill facility for encapsulation of 45,000 m3 of hazardous waste on one of the hazardous sites constructed.

actual.value: The target is fully achieved. Remediation and cleanup of hotspots sites is 100% complete with safe disposal and encapsulation atthe CDF (Confined Disposal facility) of more than 45,000 m3 hazardous waste.

title.narrative: Improvement of the water supply and sewerage system in Saranda

baseline.value: Existing water supply and sewege system ineffective to meet the waters supply and sanitation needs of Saranda

target.value: Target fully met. Reconstruction of sewer networks (2.1 km of new sewer lines) and extension of wa ter supply (2.5 km).Construction of wastewater outlet from the WWTP in Saranda to the Chuka Channe l (2.8 km). [12.5 km] Navarica Trunk main replaced.

actual.value: The target is achieved. Water supply has improved for 40,000 inhabitants of Saranda (number of population served is doubled duringthe summer season). Water capacity has increased to 70 l/sec. compared to 20 – 30 l/sec. before the investments. In addition watersupply of the Navarica village has improved, through the construction of 1 km new water pipe, serving 50 -70 households or about300 inhabitants.Works were completed at 100% according to design parameters for both water supply and sewage. This includes: (a)Construction of wastewater outlet from the WWTP in Saranda to the Cuka Channel; (b) 2.1 km sewer line within the town; and 12.9 kmNavarica Trunk main replaced and 2.8 km water supply distribution network rehabilitated in tourist area. The rehabilitation ofexisting water reservoir in Qafa e Gjashtes and construction of new one in Lekuresi (Saranda) are under implementation with thesupport of KfW water supply project.

title.narrative: Reconstruction of the water supply and sewer networks in Saranda.

baseline.value: Inadequate water supply and sanitation system in place.

target.value: Execution of water supply and sanitation works completed including wastewater outlet, 12.5 km main trunk and reservoir rehabilitation to improve storage capacity.

actual.value: Target achieved. Construction works for both the water supply and sewage 100% complete. Execution of water supply and sanitationworks which were completed include 1.9 km waste water outlet and 2.1 km sewer line within the town;12.9 km Navarica main trunkreplaced, improving existing water supply capacity and extension of distribution network in tourist area.

title.narrative: Rehabilitation of Port of Saranda facilities to facilitate tourism access to the Southern Coast.

baseline.value: N/A Saranda's old passenger port facilities in operation

target.value: Target achieved. Completion of passenger port rehabilitation infrastructure as per the design parameters; Port facilitiesoperational.

actual.value: Fully achieved. Rehabilitation of Passenger Port facilities is 100% completed. A new quay wall of 180 m and depth 9 m, includingport surface facilities are fully operational.

title.narrative: Risk assessment undertaken for the Porto Romano hot-spot.

target.value: RA completed prior to design of encapsulation and containment of contaminated si te in Porto Romano

actual.value: Completed. Chemicals waste storage in Bishti Palles (Hot Spot 4) have been repackaged and eliminated in a specialized incinerationplant in Germany in May 2006. Investigations of contaminated soil, groundwater and building material in the hot spot sites in PortoRomano carried out in 2007 prior to design of Confined Disposal Facility.

title.narrative: Social & Vulnerability Assessment carried out in accordance with agreed Terms of Reference

target.value: SVA completed in accordance with TORs

actual.value: Completed. SVA was based on TORs agreed with the Bank.

title.narrative: Landfilling and encapsulation of 45,000 m3 of hazardous waste on one of the sites.

baseline.value: No hazardous waste landfilled and encapsulated in Porto Romano.

target.value: Target achieved: a) Execution of remediation works completed by December 2010 b) Site after-care program designed and agreed withDurres municipalityand MOEFW A c) Site monitoring infrastructure in place.

actual.value: Completed. Construction of the Confined Disposal Facility (CDF) is completed. 45,000 m3 of contaminated soil and debris from thedemolition of buildings in three Hot Spots are safely encapsulated in CDF. Aftercare management, maintenance and monitoring planhas been approved and signed by MOEFWA, Durres municipality and Durres Regional Environmental Agency. The site monitoringinfrastructure is in place. Monitoring biannually is followed as per the plan.

title.narrative: Service contract signed with participating municipalities and communes for waste disposal.

baseline.value: No provisions for commercial operation of the landfill facility (prior to and at restructuring).

target.value: Target substantially met. (1) Service contract signed with participating communities (2) Contract signed with landfill operator

actual.value: The solid waste company was legally estabilished as a fully owned company by the Vlora Qark. Divestiture of shares tomunicipalities will be launched after completion of the new territorial division of the country. Service agreements were signedwith all municipalities in the service area of the landfill including the Saranda Municipality.

title.narrative: Resettlement of the families on the former site completed in accordance with the agreed Resettlement Action Plan and legal titles provided.

baseline.value: Resettlement Action Plan for Porto Romano completed prior to appraisal

actual.value: Completed. Property titles were granted to resettled families.

title.narrative: Community-based investments in coastal villages have improved environmental infrastructure enabling sustainable tourism developmentin the Southern Coast

baseline.value: There are no specific investments targeting village infrastructure in the coasta l villages supporting sustainable tourismactivities.

target.value: Round two of community based infrastructure investments including Roof and Facades Rehabilitation and B&B window implemented.

actual.value: The target is fully achieved. Round 1 and Round 2 of the CVCD investments were completed with active participation of communities.Results from Round 1: Completed projects include: water supply for more than 400 families/ or 1200 residents in Gjilek; (ii) watersupply rehabilitated for 167 families/ or 500 residents in Vuno; (iii) improved network of sewage and water supply for 800households connected to the current system in Himara Municipality; (iv) water supply for all 380 families/or 1400 residents inPiqeras); water supply for all 355 families or 1300 residents in Shen Vasil. More than 50 hotels and businesses were connected tosewage collection network. More than access 6500 m roads were constructed and/or upgraded used by local residents and visitors ofthe area. Results from Round 2: Works are completed 100% and handover for 9 road/square rehabilitation and 5 water supply schemesin the participating villages. Ten villages, benefited from Round 2 investments (Dhermi, Ilias,

title.narrative: Increased access for international tourists and access of cruise liners to the Southern Coast

baseline.value: Existing Passenger Port Terminal of Saranda is inadequate to provide access of cruise liners which is a constraint to increase thenumber of international tourists to the Southern Coast.

target.value: A new 180 m birth front with 9 meter water depth, paving, drainage, fencing and utilities constructed.

actual.value: The target is fully achieved. Rehabilitation of the Passenger Port Terminal is complete. 180 m new berth with waterfront depth of 9m and all auxiliary facilities are completed. The Port is operational. First large cruise boats visited Saranda in September andOctober 2014.

title.narrative: Technical assistance for operation and maintenance of community waste supply systems and roads and Roof & Facade (R&F) and small scale tourism provided to participating villages

baseline.value: No TA in place prior to project restructuring.

target.value: Target partially completed. a) TA for O&M of village water supply system and road maintenance provided to vi llage participationin Round two of CVCD Program; b)TA provided for the design of R&F and B&B investments

actual.value: Partially completed. Training on R&F and B&B carried out in 2013-2014. Training on O&M for Water and Road subprojects droppedbecause these services are responsibilities of Local water supply entities. Local campaing for community awareness on solid wastemanagement completed in March 2015.

title.narrative: Protection and promotion of vernacular architecture of the South Coast

target.value: Up to 62 houses included in the R&F program.

actual.value: The target is partially achieved. Project restructuring target set for the pilot R&F was in the range 35-75 houses . Desigs for 120houses for rehabiliation of Roof and Facades following local vernacular traditions were prepared in the R&F rehabilitation program.Rehabilitation of 27 houses is fully completed with contributions from owners.
